result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse A Hudson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse A Hudson

defendant.name: Hudson, Jesse A
defendant.address: c/o Delta County Jail, 2800 College Avenue, Escanaba, MI 49829

records.addlTxt: 10:03 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jesse A Hudson appeared by video, in custody from Delta County Jail.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Jevon Jones Jaconi appeared by video for Jesse A Hudson. State - here for a PH but believes it is being waived and also believe it is resolved, defendant would plead G to count #1 as alleged and dismiss and read in count #2. Hudson and Jaconi agree, Jaconi has filed the waiver of right to PH form as well. Court does waiver of right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State has filed the Information. Jaconi and Hudson have it, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas but also willing to go to sentencing today. Court does waiver of right to appear in person today instead of via Zoom. Hudson agrees to proceed via Zoom. Court makes sure the defendant knows what is means for a count to be DRI. Court dismisses and reads in count #2. Hudson pleads NC to count #1 as alleged. State -  needs to be a G plea. Hudson now pleads G to count #1 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation - has about 10 months left on what he is currently serving. Jaconi - follow Joint recommendation. Hudson makes brief statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - $500.00 fine plus costs - take bond posted - remainder due 60 fays after release from custody, submit DNA sample, felony rights given, appeal rights given, adjourned.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
10:59 AM Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jesse A Hudson appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Jevon Jones Jaconi appeared by video for Jesse A Hudson. Court has previously advised defendant of the charge and penalties. Jaconi waives further reading, requests PH and will waive time limits - defendant is currently incarcerated in the Delta County MI jail (Escanaba), will be appearing via zoom. Court considers time limits waived as per Attorney Jaconi, defendant will still be incarcerated for another 9 months, set for PH on 7/27/22 at 1:30 PM.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
on Request to Appear Remotely
To appear remotely

9:59 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jesse A Hudson not in court.  Attorney Jevon Jones Jaconi appeared by video for Jesse A Hudson. Attorney Jaconi explains Hudson's non-appearance, was sentenced to a Michigan case, unable to get set up by zoom. State no objection to resetting so defendant can appear. Court will have set for AIA. Attorney Jaconi will arranged for zoom appearance at this time. Attorney Jaconi has left the zoom. Clerk asks for bond to be reinstated. Court will proceed as Attorney will probably not object and reinstates cash bond of $500.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
